question.title: How to run a JPro application in Heroku
question.body: I have a JPro-Maven application that i run with "clean install jpro:run". I want to run-deploy same app on Heroku without too many configs or to do things perfect. I use now heroku-maven-plugin but i get Application Error in browser. Can you tell me how it's done?

answers.body:
The main issue you're hitting is probably the port binding. Heroku assigns a random port through the $PORT environment variable, and if your app doesn't bind to it within 60 seconds, Heroku just kills it and you get that Application Error page.

Here's what worked for me when I deployed a JPro app:

First, create a Procfile at the root:

web: java -jar target/jpro-0.2025.2.0-SNAPSHOT.jar

(obviously use whatever your actual jar is called)

The tricky part is getting JPro to listen on Heroku's port. You can either configure it in your pom.xml:

<configuration>
    <visible>false</visible>
    <JVMArgs>
        <JVMArg>-Xmx512m</JVMArg>
    </JVMArgs>
    <port>${PORT}</port>
</configuration>

Or just pass it in the Procfile:

web: java -jar target/your-app.jar -Djpro.port=$PORT

You'll also want to make sure you're actually building an executable jar. If you're not already using maven-shade-plugin or something similar, add that to your pom.xml build plugins.

Also check that you have a system.properties file with your Java version:

java.runtime.version=17

That should get you going. The port thing is usually what trips people up with Heroku deployments.
